intro: Knoxia microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited knoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as the buckwheat family. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth, waxy surface. Knoxia microcarpa is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
